segments.pli: Yopi hetu, yopi paccayo cakkhussa uppādāya, sopi anicco.
segments.en: The cause and condition that gives rise to the eye is also impermanent.

segments.pli: Aniccasambhūtaṃ, bhikkhave, cakkhu kuto niccaṃ bhavissati … pe …
segments.en: Since the eye is produced by what is impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Yopi hetu, yopi paccayo jivhāya uppādāya sopi anicco.
Aniccasambhūtā, bhikkhave, jivhā kuto niccā bhavissati … pe …
Yopi, bhikkhave, hetu yopi paccayo manassa uppādāya, sopi anicco.
segments.en: The cause and condition that gives rise to the mind is also impermanent.

segments.pli: Aniccasambhūto, bhikkhave, mano kuto nicco bhavissati.
segments.en: Since the mind is produced by what is impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati … pe … jivhāyapi nibbindati … pe … manasmimpi nibbindati,
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

segments.pli: nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

suttaplex.blurb: Since the causes of the six interior sense fields are impermanent, how can the senses be permanent?
